column5: A few ice shacks have been put out and the trout lakes are frozen. -9 f this morning with only a couple of inches of snow on the ground. Not much daylight these days, with sunrise at 7:58, sunset at 4:11.
We have a few shacks on the ice here in Nestor Falls, walleyes and crappies are biting..
The ice road is now open from the Dryden dock across the lake to the subdivision.
they opened the ice road in sioux lookout to south shore today on Abram Lake with 10 inches of ice, but I wouldnt be the first on Minnitaki Lake

Be careful on Minnitaki for sure. I heard from a friend that someone he knows was checking ice on Minnitaki on Sunday and it was 8-10" most places but also drilled through 3-inches close to the red marker before Harvey narrows.
I have a couple of Ontario web cam's I check to help with my post and Pre trip withdrawals. Redwing on LOW looks like that bay is icing up. How are some of the other lakes looking like?
In Sioux Lookout, Abram Lake is froze across as of yesterday, same with Pelican, even some guys have already hit the small potholes for early ice fishing. Kinda early I think for that
vermilion Bay on Eagle Lake was frozen as of yesterday morning..........
Troy and Gordon, thanks for the updates! Any others?
Wabigoon Locked up Thursday night. The smaller lakes on HWY 502 have been locked up for at least a week before that. Next weekend should be a go on some smaller lakes for fishing.BE SAFE OUT THERE!

A fox was seen crossing our lake almost two weeks ago, then a few days of warmer temps earlier last week had water on top. The lake is making ice again now and has a layer of new snow. Remember all the stories of people going through the ice in March? no rush on this end to get out there.
Last year Central Il. had a very mild winter. Sadly, a couple of folks tried to ice fish, it did not end well. Stay safe, and you just might be able to keep fishing for a long time!
http://www.tomahawkresort.ca/ReginaBayCamera.cfmAnother of my webcam therapy sites! Winter is approaching! Any other "hard water" reports?
Our bay froze first this year as always, checked it today 10 feet from shore, appeared to be at least 6 inch thick. Thunder Lake (a trout lake) was still mostly open on Monday when I went by.
After a bit of a warm up, it looks like the ice is back. According to Rob at Cherob the best ice starts with cold and not much snow. Any new reports?!
